intro: Descurainia appendiculata var. angustisecta, commonly known as narrow-leafed tansy, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as prairies and disturbed areas. Its leaves are narrow and linear, with a distinct, aromatic scent. It is considered a valuable component of native plant communities due to its ecological role and ornamental appeal.
